name: clearly
content:
clearly adverb
(EASY TO UNDERSTAND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 in a way that is easy to see, hear, read, or understand
Examples
When you fill in the form, please write clearly in black ink.The parcel was clearly labelled 'Fragile'.Their pilots are guided by an infrared optical system that shows images clearly even at night.I'm afraid I'm not expressing myself very clearly.He doesn't enunciate (his words) very clearly.

(CERTAIN)

More examplesFewer examplesThis is clearly the work of a superior artist.The audience clearly wasn't enjoying the show.I was told she would be at the meeting, but clearly I was misinformed.The president is clearly in a dilemma about how to tackle the crisis.The ball was clearly out, but the line judge said it was in.
